history.content: We no longer purge the wait lists of non majors after phase 1. (We did NOT purge the list in SP18 - the last time it was done was in F17.)
At this point no decisions have been made about F18. (We did NOT purge the list in SP18 - the last time it was done was in F17.)

children.subject: I don't know how much more clear I can make the statement above.
so declaring during summer aka after the final grades come out would not have effect on this upcoming fa 18 enrollment?
Declaring doesn't make a difference, since they won't be purging anyone from the waitlist either way
It does make a difference cuz you can enroll directly then lol

Okay gang, let's try saying it THIS way:

No one is getting systematically purged from the system prior to the end of the adjustment period unless the instructor for a particular class gives me guidance that I need to clear the entire wait list.

Whether you are declared major or not, you will be able to get on the wait list for a class beginning in phase 1. The reserve caps are set differently for each class but for many classes, declared majors will be able to enroll directly into a CS class as long as there is space. (You can see what the reserve caps are at classes.berkeley.edu - details page for the class.)

In the event that you meet the reserve cap and there is no space in the class, you will be put on the wait list. Each day (at least twice but usually more), the system automatically checks for open seats in each class component and moves in people who meet the reserve cap requirements and who have selected components with open seats.

Translation: In the example you are discussing above, the system will move declared majors in and undeclared majors will be bypassed on the wait list until their status changes to declared and they then meet the reserve cap requirement. Notice that no one is purged, but you won't get in until either your status changes to meet the reserve cap OR the reserve cap comes down and the seats are made available to everyone.

Hopefully this clarifies the process a bit.
Cindy so if I am still not declared by phase 1 does that mean that if I want to enroll in CS 168 I will be purged from the waitlist?

history.content:
Hello, an intended CS minor here. I'm just wondering if the waitlist will be purged of non majors after Phase I, like this semester.

In other words, if I were to enroll in a CS class as a non major during Phase I, will I stay on the wait list after Phase I and moving forward? Thanks.
history.subject: [Enrollment] Will wait list be purged of non majors for Fall 2018 enrollment?
